Subjective: Stress-related symptoms; muscle tension; rapid heartbeat; palpitations; shortness of breath; difficulty falling asleep; worries about work; feels overwhelmed; wants to rule out somatic causes; requests advice on managing stress; no fever; no chest pain; no dizziness; no abdominal complaints; no smoking; no alcohol; lives with housemates who are also doctors; has a good support system; impact on daily life: difficulty sleeping; fatigue; affecting work performance.
Objective: BP 120/60; HR 65/min; oxygen level 98%; breathing 14/min; normal heart sounds; no murmurs; lungs clear; abdominal examination not performed due to no complaints.
Assessment: Stress-related symptoms; possible burnout; no clear somatic cause identified; ruled out anaemia, thyroid dysfunction, and liver/kidney disease (pending blood test results).
Plan: Blood test to rule out anaemia, thyroid dysfunction, and liver/kidney disease; appointment with mental health nurse to discuss stress management; advice to take regular breaks; prioritize self-care; maintain regular sleep schedule; consider occupational health and safety service; follow-up appointment if symptoms worsen or concerns arise.
